attributes.action: abolish the House of Commons tradition of MPs addressing each other as "honourable friend", "honourable member" and "right honourable member".
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I suggest that the term "honourable" is no longer an appropriate form of address for a group of people who, through their systematic exploitation of the expenses system, have so abused their position of public trust.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
